body: As r_c stares down at m_c's body, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} nothing. m_c was a disappointment.

r_c sits respectfully, but doesn't contribute a story to m_c's vigil. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/know/knows} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should feel more about the death of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} kit, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't}.
It's sad, the vigil. More so because r_c knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} should care, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} have any grief for m_c.

r_c keeps up appearances, smoothing the fur of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} dead kit and sitting vigil, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} care that m_c is dead. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} know if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} ever loved {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, not like {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/were/was} supposed to.

r_c doesn't know if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can be blamed for the slight relief {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels}. m_c is dead and gone, and that seems overall an improvement. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/regret/regrets} ever bringing such a kit into the world.

body: r_c feels a tangle of emotions when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} kit's body. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} never cared for the child, but a wave of guilt threatens to crush {PRONOUN/m_c/object} at the thought of admitting it.
